Layer

Layers allow you to display content on screen. This can be either a static image coming from an Image patch, or the contents of a Layer Group or other dynamic image

Layer

  • Enable
  • Anchor Point
  • X Position
  • Y Position
  • Z Position
  • X Rotation
  • Y Rotation
  • Z Rotation
  • Width
  • Height
  • Image
  • Mask Image
  • Color
  • Alpha
  • Scale

Usage

Build your interface out of Layer patches. They can recieve taps in combination with the Interaction patch.

Inputs

Enable

When false, the Layer is invisible

Anchor Point

A point within the Layer's container (current Layer Group or Device patch) that you would like to position the layer relative to.

Options for positioning are:

  1. Top Left
  2. Top Center
  3. Top Right
  4. Center Left
  5. Center
  6. Center Right
  7. Bottom Left
  8. Bottom Center
  9. Bottom Right
X Position

Number of pixels to the right of the position specified in Anchor Point

Y Position

Number of pixels up from the position specified in Anchor Point

Z Position

Depth component of a layer's position in 3D space. Units are in pixels as with Width / Height

X Rotation

Rotate a layer in 3D along a horizontal line

Y Rotation

Rotate a layer in 3D along a vertical line

Z Rotation

Rotate a layer in 2D, or the Z component of a 3D rotation

Width

The width on screen in pixels the layer's Image will be shown. The eventual width is also affected by Scale and the transform of the current Layer Group.

If a value of 0.0 is passed in, the layer will take on the size of the current value of its Image input.

Height

The height on screen in pixels the layer's Image will be shown. The eventual height is also affected by Scale and the transform of the current Layer Group.

If a value of 0.0 is passed in, the layer will take on the size of the current value of its Image input.

Image

An image to show on screen

Mask Image

An image that will be used when compositing the Layer on screen to mask off certain areas so that they do not display. This is similar to layer masks in Photoshop.

Color

A color with which the Image will be tinted before display. You can use this with a pure white image to display the same shape in different colors.

Alpha

A 0-1 value will fade in the layer

Scale

How much to increase or decrease the size of the Layer. A value of 0.0 will make it invisible, whereas 2.0 will make it twice the normal size.

Outputs
